byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. reported from Chicago, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Mitch Smith from Chicago; Stephanie Saul, Fernanda Santos, Malachy Brown and Susan Beachy from New York; and Julie Turkewitz from Denver.
byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Chicago's Independent Police Review authority releases hundreds of videos as well as investigative materials related to 101 cases in which police officers used their weapons or some form of force against civilians; release is marked shift away from city's initial refusal to release video of fatal shooting of teenager Laquan McDonald.

headline.print_headline: Chicago Releases Videos of Police Shootings
headline.main: Chicago Releases Videos of Police Shootings

snippet: The video and other materials shed light on 101 cases in which officers shot or otherwise injured civilians. The city hopes to rebuild trust in the police.
